metadata.title: CVE-2016-5129 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Google V8 before 5.2.361.32, as used in Google Chrome before 52.0.2743.82,does not properly process left-trimmed objects, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption) or possibly haveunspecified other impact via crafted JavaScript code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5129` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307
chromium-browser-l10n - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307
chromium-chromedriver - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
